title: Teapot for "Apollo Skyscraper" set
text: Designers of accessories for the urban home soon drew on the "vertical" city's premier 1920s emblem, the skyscraper, as an appropriate design motif. Its terraced step-back form provided the inspiration for a host of home furnishings, from the Paul Frankl furniture currently on view in Gallery 378 of the Target Wing, and this "Skyscraper" tea and coffee set by Louis W. Rice.
description: Oxydized handles; skyscraper with smokestack as handle
creditline: The Modernism Collection, gift of Norwest Bank Minnesota
